clinical_study.brief_title: Remimazolam Besylate in Mechanically Ventilated ICU Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Remimazolam Versus Propofol for Sedation in Mechanically Ventilated ICU Patients: a Randomized, Open-label, Small Sample Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of remimazolam compared to propofol for sedation in mechanically ventilated ICU patients.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized, open-label, small sample study using remimazolam and propofol for sedation in mechanically ventilated ICU patients. Subjects are randomized to different treatment groups (including 1 for Remimazolam Besylate and 1 for propofol). Remifentanil is co-administered with remimazolam or propofol. Efficacy and safety profiles of Remimazolam Besylate are to be evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Invasive ventilator free time within 7 days
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 7 days of the study began
primary_outcome.description: The time without invasive ventilation within 7 days of the study began

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of no other sedative drugs or muscle relaxants use within 7 days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 7 days of the study began
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of participants who did not use other sedative drugs or muscle relaxants within 7 days of the study began (except for short-term use such as induction of tracheal intubation or tracheotomy)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 7 days of the study began
secondary_outcome.description: The time of survival outside of ICU within 7 days of the study began

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of successful extubation within 7 days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 7 days of the study began
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of participants who experienced successful extubation within 7 days of the study began

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 28 days of the study began
secondary_outcome.description: After follow-up, the fatality rates of all enrolled patients (including those still in ICU, transferred out and discharge) within 28 days of the study began

secondary_outcome.measure: Invasive ventilator free time in the ICU within 28 days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 28 days of the study began
secondary_outcome.description: The time without invasive ventilation in the ICU within 28 days of the study began

arm_group.description: Remimazolam continuous infusion of 0.1 to 0.2 mg/kg/h to reach a RASS score of -3 to 0. remifentanil continuous infusion of 4 to 9 ug/kg/h to reach a CPOT score of 0 to 2. The dosage adjustment plan was determined by the attending physician. Whether to use other sedative drugs is up to the attending physician.

Propofol continuous infusion of 0.5 to 4 mg/kg/h to reach a RASS score of -3 to 0. remifentanil continuous infusion of 4 to 9 ug/kg/h to reach a CPOT score of 0 to 2. The dosage adjustment plan was determined by the attending physician. Whether to use other sedative drugs is up to the attending physician.
